title.value: Efficient Graphics Representation with Differable Indirection
title.justification: Title derived from the provided text.
title.quote: Efficient Graphics Representation with Differable Indirection

extractions.description: This paper introduces a novel learned primitive called differentiable indirection, which utilizes differentiable multi-scale lookup tables to substitute traditional compute and data operations in the graphics pipeline. Applications include geometric and image representation, texture mapping, shading, and radiance field representation.

type.justification: The paper demonstrates the application of differentiable indirection on various tasks and presents empirical results, such as PSNR and performance metrics, which are typical of empirical studies.
type.quote: In all cases, differentiable indirection seamlessly integrates into existing architectures, trains rapidly, and yields both versatile and efficient results.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on improving efficiency in the graphics pipeline, including tasks such as shading, texture mapping, and image representation.
name.quote: We introduce differentiable indirection – a novel learned primitive that employs differentiable multi-scale lookup tables as an effective substitute for traditional compute and data operations across the graphics pipeline.

name.justification: The paper discusses applications like neural radiance field representation, which falls under the category of neural rendering.
name.quote: We apply differentiable indirection to various tasks in the (neural) graphics pipeline, showcasing its potential as an efficient and flexible primitive for improving runtime efficiency.

name.justification: The paper details the use of differentiable indirection for texture mapping and filtering, which are key components of texture mapping.
name.quote: Figure 5: Comparing texture compression with and without pixel footprint.

name.justification: One of the key applications of the proposed method is parametric shading using complex BRDF models like the Disney BRDF.
name.quote: We use our technique on two different BRDFs - a simple isotropic GGX and a more complex Disney BRDF.

name.justification: The paper applies differentiable indirection for compact image representations, which is a form of image compression.
name.quote: We apply differentiable indirection to real-time texture and natural image (de-)compression, and filtered texture sampling.

name.justification: The paper demonstrates the use of differentiable indirection for Signed Distance Field (SDF) representation, which is a geometric representation technique.
name.quote: SDFs volumetrically encode the zero-level set of a spatial 3D shape function. DIn readily applies to SDF representation, compressing the volumetric information in the 3D arrays.

name.justification: The entire paper revolves around this new learned primitive used for various graphics tasks.
name.quote: We introduce differentiable indirection – a novel learned primitive that employs differentiable multi-scale lookup tables.
